titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell to Nathaniel Gaither, Jr.
CWG8466

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL.
KENTUCKY.
Head-Quarters Kentucky Volunteer Militia,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Frankfort, July 28th 1862.

Hon: Nat: Gaither Jr
Sec: State-
Jesse H. Reno Qr Master has resigned -- (date of Com: 11 Novr: 1861-)
L. P. Davenport 2d Lieut: has resigned (date of Com: 22 Oct 1861)
Granville B. McGee Lieut: has resigned (date of Com: Decr 4 1861)
E. K. Ferrill Lieut: resigned (date of Com: 13 Nov 1861)
John Estes Lieut: resigned (date of Com: 12 Novr 1861)
Lieut: James M. Fiddler resigned (date of Com: 13 Novr 1861)
Capt: C. W. Gilmore resigned (date of Com: 29 March 1862)
Capt: John Johnson resigned (date of Com: 18 Novr 1861)

Lieut: Wm M. Gregory has resigned (date of Com: 11 Nov 1861)
I send One Com: for record viz:
V. S. Hay Qr Master dated 17 March 1862

I am
Sir
Very Resply
John W. Finnell
Adjt Genl
